stanza.line: Sin of self-love possesseth all mine eyeeye
And all my soul and all my every partpart
And for this sin there is no remedyremedy
It is so grounded inward in my heartheart
Methinks no face so gracious is as minemine
No shape so true no truth of such accountaccount
And for my self mine own worth do definedefine
As I all other in all worths surmountsurmount
But when my glass shows me my self indeedindeed
beated and chopt with tanned antiquityantiquity
Mine own self-love quite contrary I readread
Tis thee (my self) that for my self I praise Painting my age with beauty of thy daysdays
